column1: I'm sorry Romy was a child and the police want to know what happened to her I just want to know how I can help her, she has lost everything.
I'm a mother of a young son and a family of four. I've tried to give her what she needed but I've still never been able to see her and she needs help.
I know what I could do but I don't want to make mistakes she needs help I can't do it alone I can't do it alone, I'm not perfect I'm not perfect, I'm not perfect.
I think she is a great student and I want people to know, we have a duty to give her what she deserves.
I want to see more of those people who are struggling and do something. I want the whole community to know what we're doing because that's what the community needs.
I don't know why they're doing that. I'm just glad they're doing it.
I think they're not going to give up, they're not going to do it alone, I want to see more of those people who are struggling and do something.
I think they're not going to give up, they're not going to do it alone, I want to see more of those people who are struggling and do something.
You want a place for all people to live. I don't know why you want to give up. You have to get to know them.
I'm not a child here. I'm a mother of a young son and a family of four. I've tried to give her what she needed but I've still never been able to see her and she needs help.
I have been there many times and this is a tragedy we've all been at. This is what we need and this is what we need.
We've got to be on top of it. We've got to be on top of it.
I have been very supportive but I don't know if we can stop her.
I don't know if we can stop them because we've got to
